member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.SatHostTypes.WildBlue_LEGACY
member.summary: WildBlue type meter with Type A usage, including Download, Download Limit, Upload, and Upload Limit values, reading through an address of myaccount.DOMAIN/wbisp/DOMAIN/.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.SatHostTypes.WildBlue_EXEDE
member.summary: Exede type meter with Type B usage, including only Used and Limit values, reading through either my.exede.net or my.satelliteinternetco.com, using AJAX.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.SatHostTypes.RuralPortal_LEGACY
member.summary: RuralPortal WildBlue type meter with Type A usage, including Download, Download Limit, Upload, and Upload Limit values, reading through an address of DOMAIN.ruralportal.net.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.SatHostTypes.RuralPortal_EXEDE
member.summary: RuralPortal Exede type meter with Type B usage, including only Used and Limit values, reading through an address of DOMAIN.ruralportal.net.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.SatHostTypes.Dish_EXEDE
member.summary: Exede through Dish Network type meter with Type A2 uage, including AnyTime, AnyTime Limit, Off-Peak, and Off-Peak Limit values, reading through mydish.com.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionStates.Initialize
member.summary: The class is being initialized.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionStates.Prepare
member.summary: Praparing to log in.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionStates.Login
member.summary: Logging in.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionStates.TableDownload
member.summary: Downloading the Usage Table.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionStates.TableRead
member.summary: Reading the Usage Table.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionStates
member.summary: Current status of the connection.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.None
member.summary: Use the value instead of this value. There's no further breakdown of status.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.ReadLogin
member.summary: The login page is being read. Only Exede uses this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.Authenticate
member.summary: The username and password are being sent. All providers use this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.AuthenticateRetry
member.summary: Authentication has to be sent a second time. Exede and RuralPortal use this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.Verify
member.summary: The login is being verified. Only Dish uses this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.LoadHome
member.summary: The home page is being loaded. This is also known as the Dashboard. Exede and Dish use this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.LoadAJAX
member.summary: AJAX data off the home page is being loaded. Only Exede uses this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.LoadAJAXRetry
member.summary: The previous attempt to load AJAX data failed, so now the system is loading every page of AJAX data it can in an attempt to find the meter. Only Exede uses this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.LoadTable
member.summary: The usage meter is being loaded. This is the final step, unless it has to be retried. All providers use this step.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates.LoadTableRetry
member.summary: The usage meter is being loaded again. Sometimes it needs to be this way. Only Dish uses this step.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionSubStates
member.summary: Current stage of the connection (more detailed than ).

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.UnknownAccountType
member.summary: The Account Type is unknown, so the connection can not begin. There should be no for this .

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.UnknownAccountDetails
member.summary: The Username or Password are missing, so the connection can not begin. There should be no for this .

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.LoginIssue
member.summary: There was an issue while logging in, but the login process is still going through. Currently the only issue triggered is from with the "Your password needs to be changed." when the server is prompting the user to change the password for one reason or another.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.LoginFailure
member.summary: There was an issue while logging in. The will contain information about the .

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.FatalLoginFailure
member.summary: There was an issue while logging in, and the is wrong. The will contain information about the .

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The server timed out. There should be no for this .

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType.TLSTooOld
member.summary: The version of TLS is too old. The for this will either be the string "VER" if TLS 1.1 and 1.2 are both disabled, or "PROXY" if the TLS Proxy is disabled.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType
member.summary: Types of connection failures.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.#ctor(RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.FailureType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for a class, used in a event to notify about a problem during connection.
member.param: The describes the type of for this event. See the description for each type for details.
A message containing information about the . Not all FailureTypes use messages.

Extra data passed to the program about the , which can be reported to the RealityRipple Software servers to resolve in the next version. This is usually HTML and JavaScript from a single page of the login process or the meter.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs.Fail
member.summary: Extra data passed to the program about the , which can be reported to the RealityRipple Software servers to resolve in the next version. This is usually HTML and JavaScript from a single page of the login process or the meter.

member.summary: A message containing information about the . Not all FailureTypes use messages.

member.summary: The describes the type of for this event. See the description for each type for details.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailureEventArgs
member.summary: Information regarding the type of connection failure received and any details.

member.name: E:RestrictionLibrary.localRestrictionTracker.ConnectionFailure
member.summary: Triggered when the connection to a usage page fails or has an issue.
member.param: Instance of the class.
data regarding the failure.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.DataRow.sDATETIME
member.summary: Get a string representation of the Date and Time of the data stored in this row.
member.returns: The date and time are returned in the format "MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM", or the standard "g".

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.DataRow.sDOWNLOAD
member.summary: Get a string representation of the number of Megabytes used in download activity for this row.
member.returns: The download value is returned with standard thousands separators and no decimal.

member.returns: The download limit is returned with standard thousands separators and no decimal.

member.returns: The upload limit is returned with standard thousands separators and no decimal.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.DataRow.ToString
member.summary: Get a string representation of this row in the format "MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM [Down: 0,000/0,000][, ][Up: 0,000/0,000]".
member.returns: The return value will always contain the value, and will be followed with Download and/or Upload values if either the value or limit is greater than 0.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new DataBase with no entries.
member.remarks: If this subroutine is called on an existing database, it will be erased.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.StopNew
member.summary: Set this value to true to stop loading a databased called from the initialization subroutine.

member.summary: A progress value containing the current number of things done and the total number of things to do.

The total number of things there are to do.

member.summary: The Current number of things that have been done.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.ProgressStateEventArgs.Total
member.summary: The total number of things to do.

member.name: E:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.ProgressState
member.summary: The loading of the DataBase has progressed to a specific point.

A entry with the current Value and Total of the DataBase load's progress.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new DataBase with entries loaded from the specified .
member.param: Path to a saved DataBase in either WB, XML, or CSV formats.
Return the current progress of the load through the ProgressState event.
member.remarks: This subroutine will not begin the load process. You must call to begin loading the database. This is to allow initialization and loading at separate times or on separate threads.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.StartNew
member.summary: Begin loading DataBase entries from the path specified in the snitialization subroutine.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Add(RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.DataRow)
member.summary: Add a new DataRow entry to the DataBase.
member.param: The new DataRow entry to add.
member.remarks: The entry won't be added if it's less than one minute apart from another DataRow in the DataBase.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Merge(RestrictionLibrary.DataBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add all the entries of another DataBase into this one.
member.param: The other DataBase to include in this one.
Return the current progress of the merge through the ProgressState event.
member.remarks: The original DataBase will not be modified or erased by this process.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Clear
member.summary: Remove all entries from this DataBase.
member.remarks: This is literally identical to the initialization subroutine without parameters.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Contains(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.UInt64,RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.DataRow})
member.summary: Check for existence of an item by searching for an exact match.
member.param: The exact match of the KeyValuePair(Of UInt64, DataRow)) you wish to find.
member.returns: True is returned if the DataBase contains at least one copy of the , False otherwise.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.CopyTo(System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.UInt64,RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.DataRow}[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copy data from this DataBase into an array of DataRows.
member.param: The array of s in which to copy this DataBase.
The location at which to start copying data into in the .
member.remarks: The number of items to be copied will be equal to the space allocated for items in the from the value to the end.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.ToArray
member.summary: Convert this DataBase into an array of entries.
member.returns: The full list of entries in this DataBase.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Count
member.summary: The total number of entries in this DataBase.
member.remarks: The value will be 0 if the DataBase is not initialized or if it's been erased.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the DataBase is read-only.
member.returns: This property is always false because it is always false for all arrays.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Remove(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Remove a DataRow entry from the DataBase.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase.Remove(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Remove a DataRow entry from the DataBase.
member.param: The DataRow entry to remove.
member.returns: True if the entry was successfully removed from the DataBase, False if the entry could not be found.
member.remarks: This function only uses the value to compare against entries in the DataBase.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.DataBase
member.summary: Stores information about usage activity for an account, with access to subroutines and functions for manipulating the list and storing it as one of three file types.
member.remarks: This class also contains a child class which provides access to individual events of this larger list and is used as a Type in some instances.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a randomly generated key.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.RR_HMACSHA512.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key data.
member.param: The secret key for System.Security.Cryptography.HMACSHA512 encryption. The key can be any length. However, if it is more than 64 bytes long it will be hashed (using SHA-1) to derive a 64-byte key. Therefore, the recommended size of the secret key is 64 bytes.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.RR_HMACSHA512.ProduceLegacyHmacValues
member.summary: Provides a workaround for the .NET Framework version 2.0 implementation of the algorithm, which is inconsistent with the .NET Framework version 2.0 Service Pack 1 implementation.
member.returns: true to enable .NET Framework version 2.0 Service Pack 1 applications to interact with .NET Framework 2.0 applications; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.RR_HMACSHA512
member.summary: SHA-512 hashing with support for the Legacy HMAC values of .NET 2.0 and modern values provided by .NET 2.0 SP1 and newer.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.remoteRestrictionTracker.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Net.IWebProxy,System.Int32,System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor of the class, which also starts the connection process.
member.param: The Remote Usage Service account to connect to, which consists of the meter page Username and Provider Domain separated by an "@".
The password for the account. If this is set to blank, the connection will terminate after the event, which is useful for verifying the legitimacy of a without initiating a full connection.
The account's Product Key, including hyphens, in the format XXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXX
Proxy settings for connecting to the Remote Usage Service.
How long to wait between messages before timing out during connection.

The earliest date to grab information from. The Remote Usage Service will return data from this date until the present time, rather than an entire usage history. Set the year to 2000 to grab the whole history.
The directory where configuration data is stored. This is used for reporting socket errors. If this value is null, then socket errors are not reported.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.remoteRestrictionTracker
member.summary: Accesses the Remote Usage Service and handles all communication internally.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.REPLACE_COMMA
member.summary: This constant replaces any commas in the values of cookies received, and will be replaced by commas on any cookies being sent.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.REPLACE_SEMIC
member.summary: This constant replaces any semicolons in the values of cookies received, and will be replaced by semicolons on any cookies being sent.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.CookieJar
member.summary: Acts as the container for a collection of objects for use with an instance of the class.
member.value: A new CookieJar to use in place of the default empty Jar. This is useful for sharing and storing sessions and cookies across multiple instances.
member.returns: The current CookieJar for this .

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.SendCookieJar
member.summary: The way cookies are sent can be modified using this property.
member.value: Cookies will be sent by text if this value is False, and by both text and cookie jar if True.
member.returns: See the value entry for details on the return values.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.ResponseURI
member.summary: The of the last event after any redirection.
member.returns: Initially, the value will be Nothing until a event occurs. It may be equal to the sent in a Download or Upload request, or it may be modified during the request as per page redirection standards*.
member.remarks: *Page Redirection can be disabled using the property. The standards followed if is set to False are the HTTP 300 Status Code set of errors. Up to 50 redirects are allowed if has not been set manually.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-out value in seconds for the and methods.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds to wait before the request times out. The default is 120 seconds.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.ReadWriteTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out in seconds when writing to or reading from a stream.
member.returns: The number of seconds before the writing or reading times out. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes).

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.HTTPVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of HTTP to use for the request.
member.returns: The HTTP version to use for the request. The default is .

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.ErrorBypass
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines how the reacts to the HTTP 400 Status Code set of errors.
member.value: If set to True and the error contains a value, that response is sent instead of an error.
member.returns: If True, errors may be bypassed and trigger Upload and Download completion events, if possible. If False, all error responses are treated as errors. The default value is True.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.KeepAlive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to make a persistent connection to the Internet resource.
member.value: If set to True, the will send a Connection HTTP header with the value Keep-alive; if False, Close.
member.returns: True if the request to the Internet resource should contain a Connection HTTP header with the value Keep-alive; otherwise, False. The default is True.

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.ManualRedirect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines how the reacts to the HTTP 300 Status Code set of errors.
member.returns: False if the request should automatically follow redirection responses from the Internet resource; otherwise, True. The default value is True.

member.name: E:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientCore.Failure
member.summary: A Upload or Download request has failed.
member.param: The class which is triggering the event.
The exception contained in an EventArg

member.name: P:RestrictionLibrary.WebClientEx.IsBusy
member.summary: Returns a Boolean value that provides information about the state of the request.
member.returns: If True, the request has been processed and is being sent, the client is waiting for the server, or data is being received in response. Otherwise, the request has not yet been sent or a response has already been received.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.SecurityProtocolTypeEx.None
member.summary: Specifies no security protocol is to be used.
member.remarks: This value is technically invalid, but exists for use with Settings to allow no protocol to be selected in the case of a Remote Usage Service subscription.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.SecurityProtocolTypeEx.Ssl3
member.summary: Specifies the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) 3.0 security protocol.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.SecurityProtocolTypeEx.Tls10
member.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0 security protocol.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.SecurityProtocolTypeEx.Tls11
member.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.1 security protocol.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.SecurityProtocolTypeEx.Tls12
member.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.2 security protocol.

member.name: T:RestrictionLibrary.SecurityProtocolTypeEx
member.summary: Specifies the security protocols that are supported by the Schannel security package.
member.remarks: This contains the additional TLS 1.1 and 1.2 standards lacking in , which require newer .NET Framework versions.

member.name: F:RestrictionLibrary.srlFunctions.LATIN_1
member.summary: ISO-8859-1 Latin-1 Encoding
member.remarks: Charset for Latin-1 when using Text Encoding functions.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.srlFunctions.PercentEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a string for use in HTML form submissions.
member.param: The string you wish to percent-encode.
member.returns: A string identical to except that nonalphanumeric characters are encoded for use in HTML forms.

remarks.para: This function percent-encodes all non-alphanumeric characters with four exceptions.
Spaces will be replaced with a "+" rather than "%20".
Hyphens, Underscores, and Asterisks will be left alone.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.srlFunctions.PadHex(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Convert an Integer into a hexadecimal string with an appropriate zero-prefix padding.
member.param: The base-10 number you wish to convert to base-16.
member.returns: A string containing the hexadecimal value that was passed to the function.

remarks.para: If the length of the hexadecimal value is less than 8 characters and odd, one zero is prefixed.
If the length of the hexadecimal value is between 9 and 15 characters, enough zeroes are prefixed to bring the length to 16.
If the length of the hexadecimal value is between 17 and 31 characters, the string will be padded to 32.
If the length of the hexadecimal value is between 33 and 63 characters, the string will be padded to 64.
If the length of the hexadecimal value is between 65 and 127 characters, the string will be padded to 128.
If the length of the hexadecimal value is greater than 128, the string will not be padded.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.srlFunctions.PadHex(System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Convert an Integer into a hexadecimal string with a specific zero-prefix padding.
member.param: The base-10 number you wish to convert to base-16.
The minimum length of the output value.
member.returns: A string containing the hexadecimal value that was passed to the function.
member.remarks: If the length of the hexadecimal value is greater than then no padding is performed.

member.name: M:RestrictionLibrary.srlFunctions.HexDecode(System.String)
member.summary: Reverts hexadecimal HTML entities in a string to their original characters.
member.param: The string you wish to decode.
member.returns: A string identical to except that all encoded values have been decoded.
member.remarks: A hexadecimal HTML entity is in the form of &#xNN;, where NN is a hexadecimal ASCII value for the character it represents.
